quest.name: Fresh Meat
quest.synopsis: You made it to Tier 1. That's better than most rookies. Chen says maybe you'll last a month. But now the real competition begins. You're not the only fresh courier grinding for survival. Meet Jin—another Tier 1, hungry, aggressive, and willing to cut corners you won't. When a high-value contract appears, you both want it. Chen gives it to whoever performs better on a test run.
quest.description: This quest establishes rating competition (other couriers exist, they're threats), rival character (Jin, recurring antagonist/frenemy), moral gray areas (cutting corners vs. staying clean), and scarcity mindset (not enough contracts for everyone).

primary.description: Complete test delivery faster than rival courier Jin
Impress Chen enough to get the premium contract

optional.description: Learn about Jin's background from Rosa
Help Jin when they get in trouble

act1_setup.title: Competition
act1_setup.hook: Chen calls you in. 'Got a premium contract. Corp client, regular deliveries, great pay. But I can only give it to one courier. You and Jin are both Tier 1. You both want it. So race.'
context: Player has been doing standard runs since Tier 0
First encounter with another named courier
Chen explains: 'This is the life. Not enough work for everyone. Someone gets ahead, someone falls behind.'

jinIntroduction.description: Young (early 20s), cocky, visibly augmented (reflex boosters, enhanced eyes)
jinIntroduction.attitude: Dismissive. 'You're still meat-only? Good luck keeping up.'
jinIntroduction.background: Been a courier for 6 months, already Tier 1 through aggressive tactics

chenTest.description: Both of you take the same package type to the same destination. Whoever arrives first with package intact gets the contract. Simple. Fair.
chenTest.reality: [not actually fair—Jin has augments, player doesn't]

options.label: That's not fair. They have chrome.
options.chenResponse: Life's not fair. Deal with it.

options.label: What if we both do well?
options.chenResponse: There's one contract. One winner. That's how this works.

testDelivery.description: Both player and Jin get packages. Same destination: Night Market (familiar route from Tier 0). Jin leaves immediately, aggressively.

playerChoices.name: Drive Safe (High Integrity)
playerChoices.outcome: Slower, but arrives with perfect package condition
playerChoices.likelyResult: Arrives second (Jin faster due to chrome + risk-taking)

playerChoices.name: Drive Aggressive (Speed Priority)
playerChoices.outcome: Faster, but package may take damage

playerChoices.name: Sabotage Jin (Underhanded)
playerChoices.description: Actively interfere with Jin's run (hack route, create obstacles)

complication.description: Halfway through the race, player sees Jin's vehicle crash (avoiding obstacles, took too many risks)

crashChoices.label: Stop and Help Jin
crashChoices.outcome: Lose race (Jin delivers late or not at all, but you also arrive late)
crashChoices.chenReaction: Respects humanity, gives contract anyway (impressed by character)

crashChoices.label: Keep Going, Win Race
crashChoices.outcome: Win race by default (Jin can't complete)

crashChoices.label: Call Rosa to Help, Then Continue
crashChoices.description: Quick call to Rosa: 'Jin crashed at [location], can you check on them?'
crashChoices.outcome: Rosa helps Jin, you continue and arrive on time (win race)

act3_resolution.title: First Real Choice

helpedJin.chenDialogue: You stopped. You helped a competitor. That's... not what most do. [pause] The contract's yours. Not because you won. Because I can trust you with premium clients. They need reliability, not just speed.
helpedJin.jinDialogue: You... you stopped for me. Why?

playerOptions.label: Didn't want your death on my conscience.
We're not enemies. We're both just trying to survive.

abandonedJin.chenDialogue: You won. Jin crashed, couldn't deliver. Contract's yours. [looks at you] You could've stopped. You didn't. That's the choice you made.

playerOptions.label: I had a job to do.

jinLater.dialogue: You left me there. I could've died.

playerOptions.label: This is a competition. You'd have done the same.
playerOptions.jinResponse: Probably. Doesn't mean I won't remember.

calledRosa.chenDialogue: You won. But you also called Rosa to help Jin. Smart. You got what you wanted and didn't leave a body in the street.
calledRosa.rosaComms: Jin's okay. Banged up, but stable. Appreciate the call.
calledRosa.jinLater: Heard you called for help. While winning. Efficient. I respect that.

premiumContract.deliveries: Weekly medical supplies, high value, strict deadlines
premiumContract.catch: Client has high standards, one screw-up and you're blacklisted

act3_resolution.chenClosing: This is a step up. Don't screw it. You screw this, you don't just lose a client—you get a reputation as unreliable. Then everyone drops you. Welcome to Tier 1. It doesn't get easier. You just get better. Or you get crushed.

branchingPaths.name: Helped Jin (Compassionate)
branchingPaths.outcome: Premium contract earned through character, not just speed

branchingPaths.name: Called Rosa (Pragmatic)
branchingPaths.outcome: Premium contract earned through smart problem-solving

complications.description: Forces player to choose: wait (lose time) or illegal detour (risk)
Arrives damaged, Chen deducts rating points

shortTerm.jinRelationship: Set for rest of game (ally, enemy, or neutral)

longTerm.jinArc: If saved, becomes ally. If abandoned, becomes antagonist (may sabotage you later)
longTerm.chenPerception: Sees what kind of courier you are
longTerm.reputation: Word spreads (helped competitor = soft? or reliable?)

locations.name: Standard delivery route to Night Market

npcs.description: Young (early 20s), cocky, visibly augmented (reflex boosters, enhanced eyes)

centralQuestion: When survival is a competition, do you help someone who might take your place?

jinCharacter: Augmented out of necessity, not choice
Can become genuine friend if player shows character
OR bitter rival if player shows ruthlessness
chenReaction: Tests player's values, not just speed
Already knows who'll win (Jin has chrome)
Wants to see if player will do the right thing under pressure
tone: Scarcity breeds conflict (system's fault, not individuals')
First glimpse of 'not everyone makes it'
